Claim of the Applicant: Applicant alleged discrimination in promotion decisions.
Lessons Learned: Promotion processes must be equitable and based on objective criteria.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant challenged reassignment and exclusion from responsibilities, alleging retaliation.
Lessons Learned: Reassignments must be justified and clearly communicated.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant disputed a negative performance evaluation and its impact on contract renewal.
Lessons Learned: Performance evaluations must be fair, evidence-based, and transparent.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant alleged procedural flaws in a misconduct investigation.
Decision: Tribunal found partial merit and ordered procedural review.
Lessons Learned: Investigations must follow due process and ensure fairness.
IOA Category: 2.k – Disciplinary and Code of Conduct Issues

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant contested denial of a mobility premium.
Lessons Learned: Eligibility criteria for mobility benefits must be clearly defined and consistently applied.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant alleged discrimination in promotion decisions.
Lessons Learned: Promotion decisions must be based on documented, objective criteria.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant challenged denial of pension credit for prior service under a special appointment.
Lessons Learned: Pension eligibility must align with policy and communicated limitations.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant challenged denial of pension credit for prior service under a special appointment.
Lessons Learned: Pension eligibility must align with policy and communicated limitations.

Claim of the Applicant: Applicant alleged procedural flaws in a disciplinary process and excessive sanctions.
Decision: Tribunal found partial merit and ordered reconsideration.
Lessons Learned: Disciplinary actions must be proportionate and follow fair procedures.
